item.title: How Python and R can talk to each other
item.description: Python and R can be thought of as two different languages of coding. There are certain packages such as reticulate, that can use interacting information from both R and Python. Reticulate allows you to run a Python session embedded in your R markdown, you can access code chunks created within R in Python and vice versa, and you can translate between R and Python objects when using things such Pandas.
